meanings.definition: To untangle or arrange (hair) by drawing a comb through it.
meanings.sent1: She was combing her long hair before going to bed.
meanings.sent2: I comb my hair every morning to make it neat.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried combing its fur with its paws, looking quite puzzled.
meanings.sent4: The detective was combing through the evidence to find the clue.
meanings.sent5: The gardener was combing the soil with a rake, preparing it for planting.

meanings.definition: The act of using a comb to untangle or arrange hair.
meanings.sent1: Her combing of the hair was gentle and precise.
meanings.sent2: I found her combing on the dresser in the bathroom.
meanings.sent3: The combing of the hair became a daily ritual for the little girl.
meanings.sent4: The combing of the wheat fields by the wind created a mesmerizing pattern.
meanings.sent5: The combing of the hair at the salon was a relaxing experience for the customer.
